intro: Brunellia tomentosa, commonly known as the velvet tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it its common name. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a thick layer of soft, white pubescence. The flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and often have a pleasant fragrance, attracting various pollinators.
